Modification_Detail.description: ERRATA_ID=ODTIR-0001-2.0 Updated CAL_IR_IMAGE software v5.2 and IR-RDR v2.0. PDS4 XML label generated for this version of the described data product.
ERRATA_ID=ODTIR-0001-1.7 Updated CAL_IR_IMAGE software v5.1 for all images
ERRATA_ID=ODTIR-0001-1.6 Improved STRAYLIGHT algorithm in CAL_IR_IMAGE v4.8; source IR-EDR header updated and propagated
ERRATA_ID=ODTIR-0001-1.4 Header updated to include IMAGE_DURATION
ERRATA_ID=ODTIR-0001-1.3 Error propagated during data format change
ERRATA_ID=ODTIR-0001-1.1 Change data to 16-bit; scaling factors are per band

Primary_Result_Summary.description: MARS ODYSSEY THEMIS Standard Data Products, INFRARED RDR Version 1.0

sp:Field_of_View.sp:description: The IR focal plane is an uncooled microbolometer with 320 cross-track pixels and 240 down-track pixels with an instantaneous field of view (IFOV) of 0.25 milli-radians (100m from 400km altitude). The focal plane is temperature stabilized to ~0.001 K using a temperature controller driving a thermo-electric heater/cooler. Ten stripe filters are placed over the microbolometer array to produce ten ~1-m wide spectral bands at nine separate wavelengths centered from 6.8 to 14.9 micrometers. Two filters (Bands 1 and 2) cover the same spectral region centered at 6.8 micrometers.

sp:Bin_Description.sp:bin_profile_description: Center_wavelength is the position of the mid-point (half maximum) of the normalized relative spectral response for each band. Band width is the calculated spectral full-width at same half maximum (FWHM) location.

proc:Process.proc:name: SFDU2CUBE
proc:Process.proc:description: Translation of data format from SFDU into raw image qube(THM-EDR). Removes SFDU headers and unpackages data; returns an individual spectral image QUBE (THM-EDR) containing raw DN, with missing data CORE_NULL filled and an attched PDS label.

proc:Process.proc:name: CAL_IR_IMAGE
proc:Process.proc:description: Calibration of a raw, infrared image (IREDR). Uses DN, gain and offset values from raw image with the instrument response function and a calibration flag image (IREDR); returns a calibrated spectral radiance image (IRRDR) in (W cm-2 str-1 um-1).

proc:Process.proc:name: GEOMETRY_QUALITY
proc:Process.proc:description: The quality of the projected location of a THEMIS image can be affected by multiple factors,which are summarized here along with the assessed GEOMETRY_QUALITY_RATING. See the GEOMETRY/GEOMETRY.PDF for a full discussion of the individual parameters.

Internal_Reference.comment: Description of Odyssey spacecraft pointing modes used throughout investigation

External_Reference.reference_text: Christensen, P. R.; Bandfield, J. L.; Hamilton, V. E.; Ruff, S. W.; Kieffer, H. H.; Titus, T. N.; Malin, M. C.; Morris, R. V.; Lane, M. D.; Clark, R. L.; Jakosky, B. M.; Mellon, M. T.; Pearl, J. C.; Conrath, B. J.; Smith, M. D.; Clancy, R. T.; Kuzmin, R. O.; Roush, T.; Mehall, G. L.; Gorelick, N.; Bender, K.; Murray, K.; Dason, S.; Greene, E.; Silverman, S.; Greenfield, M., 2001, "Mars Global Surveyor Thermal Emission Spectrometer experiment: Investigation description and surface science results", Journal of Geophysical Research, Volume 106, Issue E10, p. 23823-23872.
External_Reference.description: Instrument overview in a journal publication
